articles.description: Manchester City come from behind to beat Everton as the champions keep pace with Premier League leaders Liverpool.
articles.title: Champions Man City come from behind to beat Everton

articles.description: Noni Madueke scores an 89th-minute winner from the penalty spot to help Chelsea overcome Crystal Palace at Stamford Bridge in the Premier League.
articles.title: Late Madueke penalty helps Chelsea beat Palace

articles.description: Hwang-Hee chan scores twice as Wolves inflict a fourth consecutive Premier League defeat on a depleted Brentford side in a frenetic affair at the Gtech Community Stadium.
articles.title: Hwang scores twice as Wolves thrash Brentford

articles.description: Australia captain Pat Cummins and Nathan Lyon reduce Pakistan to 194-6, trailing the hosts by 124 runs after day two of the second Test.
articles.title: Cummins & Lyon put Australia on top against Pakistan

articles.description: Teenager Luke Littler cruises into the last 16 of his debut PDC World Championship with a comfortable win over Matt Campbell.
articles.title: PDC World Championship 2024: Teenager Luke Littler beats Matt Campbell to reach last 16

articles.description: Ukraine cherishes "every single athlete we have" as they might be the country's "last star shining", says former tennis player Sergiy Stakhovsky.
articles.title: Sergiy Stakhovsky: Ukraine's ex-tennis star condemns IOC's Russia Olympics decision

articles.description: The crowds arrive for Championship fortnight, but for the other 50 weeks of the year, work continues at the All England Club.
articles.title: Winter at Wimbledon - Inside the Slam that never sleeps

articles.description: Rasmus Hojlund's first Premier League goal marks the start of a new era at Manchester United, writes Simon Stone.
articles.title: 'Hojlund breaks duck to mark start of new Man Utd era'

articles.description: Novak Djokovic believes Rafael Nadal will be competitive at January's Australian Open, despite his long injury absence.
articles.title: Djokovic says Nadal will 'want to be the best' again

articles.description: The Detroit Pistons set a new record for the longest losing streak in a single NBA season after the Brooklyn Nets inflict a 27th straight defeat.
articles.title: NBA round-up: Detroit Pistons set single-season losing record with 27th straight defeat
